1.「やァ <pc>君。| 先ほどは 見苦しい所を見せてしまったね。| 前回の非礼と:
Hey . I'm sorry I showed you|something unsightly ze' other day. Let me|apologize for that, as well as for my rudeness|

10.「ヒーたんが 考古学者になったのは| 僕が あきらめざるを得なかった 夢を| 代: I thought that when my sister became an|archaeologist, she was trying to take ze'|place of ze' dream I had to give up.

11.「だから それで ヒーたんが苦しむのは| 我慢ならなかった。あのルーペが呪縛にな: So I couldn't stand to see my sister suffer|because of it. I couldn't allow that loupe to|become a curse and cause my sister to suffer.

12.「だけど さっきの あの子の言葉を聞いて | 心が 軽くなった気がしたよ。彼女は: But after hearing her words earlier, I felt|lightened. I realized that she had already|been pursuing her own dream!

13.「メルシー <pc>君！ あんな妹だが| これからも 仲良くしてやってくれたまえ: Merci <pc>! She's such a little|sister, but please continue to be good to her.

15.「うーん 気持ちいいな！| こういうの 一度 やってみたかったんだ。| 行儀が悪: Zis' feels so good! I've always vanted' to|try something like zis'. It's so raw, but|it's so exciting!

16.「きれいだなぁ……| リンジャーラたちも こんな風に| 星を 見ていたんだろうか: It's so beautiful... I vonder' if Linjara and|ze 'others were looking at ze' stars like|zis'.

17.「兄の 言うとおりなんだ。 | キミが苦労して 手記を 手に入れてくれたのに|: My brother vas' right. You went through all|zat' trouble to receive ze' journal, and I|couldn't do anything about it.

Well... at first, it vas' touted as a new|discovery, but since no archaeological|evidence has been found to support it, no one|
|listens to me anymore. I'm not sure.

20.「……なんてね。ウソだよ。| だから そんな困った顔を しないでくれ。| キミは: Hey, I vas' kidding. So don't make such a|troubled face. You really are a kind person.

23.「考古学が大好きだから こんなに くやしいし | 捨て去ることなんて できそうに: I love archaeology so much, it's such a|bummer, and I don't think I could ever get rid|of it.

24.「今日は そばにいてくれて ありがとう。 | いつかキミが 助けを必要としている: Merci beaucoup, mon ami. Someday if you ever|need help, I'll be there for you.

28.「これは……？| ファラスの手記では なさそうだな。| どれどれ……: Is zis'...? It doesn't look like Faras's|journal. Let's see...

Today, a friend of mine and I went to the|annual night festival with three other|people. My best friend, that guy, and... her,|
|who came a little later.

30.いつもは 静かなこの地も 祭りの夜には |色とりどりの灯りで あざやかに彩られ|: This normally quiet place is filled with|colorful lights and the sound of people's|voices on festival nights.

31.珍しい食べ物に ゆかいな催し物 美しい花火……|夢か幻のような時の中で 私たちは: We laughed and laughed in a time that seemed|like a dream or a vision. And just as we were|about to head home...

32.ふたりが先日 婚約したという話を聞いた。|両者とも 人として尊敬できる 大切な友: I heard that they got engaged the other day.|Both of them are dear friends whom I respect|as people. I offered my congratulations.

Afterwards, we stood on a hill, a memorable|place for all three of us, watching the|meteors and pledging our everlasting|

34.ふたりに出会うことができて 本当によかった。|この先 何があっても 私たち３人な:
